New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder extended their win streak to a franchise-record 13 in a row
Key Match Events: The Thunder scored 26 points in the second quarter to cut the halftime deficit to 52-48
The Thunder outscored the Clippers 42-20 in the third quarter to completely flip the scoreboard
The Thunder led by as many as 16 points in the first quarter
The Clippers finished the first quarter on a 12-2 run to exit it with a 30-22 advantage
Post-Match Reflections: Gilgeous-Alexander finished with 29 points on 9-of-17 shooting, eight assists and three rebounds
Williams finished with 18 points on 8-of-14 shooting, four assists and three rebounds
Hartenstein finished with 11 points on 5-of-9 shooting, nine rebounds, six assists and two blocks
Wiggins finished with nine points on 4-of-7 shooting, four rebounds and two assists
The depleted Clippers were light work for Gilgeous-Alexander
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder shot 50% from the field and went 14-of-38 (36.8%) from 3
They went 16-of-20 from the free-throw line
Amir Coffey led the way with 26 points on 10-of-14 shooting and went 6-of-8 from 3
Zubac had 11 points and nine rebounds
Mo Bamba had 12 points and eight rebounds
Norman Powell was limited to six points on 1-of-11 shooting
Others: The game was part of a tough back-to-back for the Thunder
The Clippers were short-handed without Kawhi Leonard and James Harden
